item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?" -- Rumi

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "There's no bitch on earth like a mother frightened for her kids." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "Love is lak de sea. It’s uh movin’ thing, but still and all, it takes its shape from de shore it meets, and it’s different with every shore." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Osip Mandelstam
item.description: "My turn shall also come: I sense the spreading of a wing." -- Osip Mandelstam

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "The bravest people are the ones who don’t mind looking like cowards." -- T.H. White

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Thor Heyerdahl
item.description: "Progress is man's ability to complicate simplicity." -- Thor Heyerdahl

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Annie Proulx
item.description: "You know, one of the tragedies of real life is that there is no background music." -- Annie Proulx

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Peg Bracken
Kathleen add a quote by Bill Nye
item.description: "Everyone you will ever meet knows something you don't." -- Bill Nye

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "Tyger! Tyger! burning bright In the forests of the night, What immortal hand or eye Could frame thy fearful symmetry?" -- William Blake

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Carlo Levi
item.description: "The future has an ancient heart." -- Carlo Levi

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I live my life in widening circles that reach out across the world." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn
item.description: "The belly is an ungrateful wretch, it never remembers past favors, it always wants more tomorrow." -- Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Children must be taught how to think, not what to think." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Like all of my friends, she's a lousy judge of character." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Chris Abani
item.description: "What I've come to learn is that the world is never saved in grand messianic gestures, but in the simple accumulation of gentle, soft, almost invisible acts of compassion." -- Chris Abani

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I hope you will have a wonderful year, that you'll dream dangerously and outrageously, that you'll make something that didn't exist before you made it, that you will be loved and that you will be liked, and that you will have people to love and to like in return. And, most importantly (because I think there should be more kindness and more wisdom in the world right now), that you will, when you need to be, be wise, and that you will always be kind." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read." -- Nicholson Baker

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "You could move.' ---"Dear Abby" responds to a reader who complained that a gay couple was moving in across the street and wanted to know what he could do to improve the quality of the neighborhood." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "Accept who you are. Unless you're a serial killer." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Colette
item.description: "I went to collect the few personal belongings which...I held to be invaluable: my cat, my resolve to travel, and my solitude." -- Colette

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Hold fast to dreams, For if dreams die Life is a broken-winged bird, That cannot fly." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Stewart O'Nan
item.description: "You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved." -- Stewart O'Nan

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Sinclair Lewis
item.description: "We'd get sick on too many cookies, but ever so much sicker on no cookies at all." -- Sinclair Lewis
